bankruptcy act, 1966 (cth), ss 109 , 187 (1)(b), 243(1). held: (1) the essence of a composition under the bankruptcy act 1966 (cth) s. 187(1)(b) , as between the debtor and the general body of creditors, is that all creditors be accorded equal treatment.
income tax
assessable income
payments pursuant to motor accidents act 1973 (vic.), s. 25 (1)
compensation for "loss of income in capacity of employee"
whether income or capital
comparison with common law damages
income tax assessment act 1936 (cth.), s. 25

motor accidents act 1973 (vic.), ss. 13, 20, 21, 25, 32, 79. the taxpayer received payments under the motor accidents act 1973 (vic.). she had been injured in a motor car accident and had "suffered a loss of income in the capacity of employee by reason of the injury" (s.25 (1) of the motor accidents act ). she received $2,371.20 in twenty-two payments over about nine months. the commissioner assessed her on the payments as income. for the taxpayer, it was argued that the payments were of a capital nature because they were compensation for a loss of earning capacity. jenkinson j. of the supreme court of victoria held that the payments were assessable as income. the taxpayer appealed.  held, dismissing the appeal, that an analysis of the motor accident act indicated that the payments were for the purpose of providing partial recoupment of lost income. furthermore, from the taxpayer's point of view, the periodic receipt of the payments suggested that they were of an income nature.  hearing  melbourne, 1979, august 2-3; december 14. 14:12:1979
